lines.text: How can I confess to something I haven't done?
In a democracy, the midnight knock on the door can be friendly.
It's a miracle. He's delivered himself. Like a fantastic surprise Christmas present, left at the door.
[last lines]
I can't do it Paulina. I just can't.
[first lines]
Are you quite sure you won't come in?
No thanks, just want to get home after that.
Yeah, me too. Look, I'm really sorry for all the trouble I put you to.
Yeah, no problem.
Well if I can't persuade you, why don't you come over some time. Thanks again, goodbye.

[returning again to the car]
Ah, you now it's crazy, I never introduced myself. Gerardo Escobar.
Dr. Roberto Miranda.
It's very nice to meet you. If you're ever passing...
Escobar? The lawyer?
Yeah, that's right.
Just give me time. Give us time. I promise you, I'll *get* them for you. I'll bring you justice instead of a flat tire.
It must be some kids out for a joyride.
No, this time I really do have something to apologize for. My wife took your car.
She went out for a tire?
As long as you're holding the gun, we have nothing to discuss.
On the contrary, the minute I give up the gun all discussion will end.
She's mad, she needs therapy.
You *are* her therapy.
